channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In an election race this close, Asian American voters have become a force
item.description: Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.
item.content:encoded:
Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.

(Image credit: Deepa Shivaram)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Highlighting Indigenous voices across NPR’s network
item.description: NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.
item.content:encoded:
NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.

(Image credit: Left photo: Joseph Scheller)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: China holds large military exercises surrounding Taiwan to warn against independence
item.description: China deployed ships and warplanes in large-scale military exercises surrounding Taiwan Monday, simulating the sealing off of ports in a move that underscores the tense situation in the Taiwan Strait.
item.content:encoded:
China deployed ships and warplanes in large-scale military exercises surrounding Taiwan Monday, simulating the sealing off of ports in a move that underscores the tense situation in the Taiwan Strait.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The U.S. gets a new national marine sanctuary, the first led by a tribe
item.description: Over 4,500 square miles of ocean will be protected off the California coast. It will also be managed in partnership with the indigenous groups that fought to create it.
item.content:encoded:
Over 4,500 square miles of ocean will be protected off the California coast. It will also be managed in partnership with the indigenous groups that fought to create it.

(Image credit: Mario Tama/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Come hurricane or high water, Florida island residents promise to stay
item.description: As climate change makes hurricanes stronger and more intense, island communities like Longboat Key are particularly susceptible to catastrophic damage from hurricanes. Residents say they are sticking around.
item.content:encoded:
As climate change makes hurricanes stronger and more intense, island communities like Longboat Key are particularly susceptible to catastrophic damage from hurricanes. Residents say they are sticking around.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: In outreach to Black men, Harris to vow to legalize weed, protect crypto
item.description: Polls show that some Black men may be gravitating toward former President Trump or not vote at all. Vice President Harris and other prominent Democrats are trying to counter that.
item.content:encoded:
Polls show that some Black men may be gravitating toward former President Trump or not vote at all. Vice President Harris and other prominent Democrats are trying to counter that.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: To curb polio outbreak, children in Gaza are receiving a booster vaccine dose
item.description: The World Health Organization said a second dose will be crucial in order to stop the spread of the virus in Gaza and internationally.
item.content:encoded:
The World Health Organization said a second dose will be crucial in order to stop the spread of the virus in Gaza and internationally.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Bob Woodward takes NPR behind the headline-grabbing moments in his new book
item.description: Bob Woodward speaks to NPR about the revelations in his new book, and recounts how key moments and meetings in recent years played out behind closed doors.
item.content:encoded:
Bob Woodward speaks to NPR about the revelations in his new book, and recounts how key moments and meetings in recent years played out behind closed doors.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: A spacecraft headed to one of Jupiter's moons is set to launch
item.description: Europa Clipper will make a six-year journey to Jupiter to study Europa, an icy-surfaced moon that scientists believe has “ingredients for life.”
item.content:encoded:
Europa Clipper will make a six-year journey to Jupiter to study Europa, an icy-surfaced moon that scientists believe has “ingredients for life.”

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: 60 years ago, a jet-powered tricycle shattered the land speed record
item.description: Craig Breedlove became the first person to drive faster than 500 miles per hour. But his record-breaking run almost ended in disaster.
item.content:encoded:
Craig Breedlove became the first person to drive faster than 500 miles per hour. But his record-breaking run almost ended in disaster.

(Image credit: Bettmann)
item.dc:creator: Julian Ring
